required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Coherence Imaging of the Cervical Epithelium With Scanning a/LCI
clinical_study.official_title: Coherence Imaging of the Cervical Epithelium With Scanning a/LCI

brief_summary.textblock:
The purpose of this study is to develop a low coherence interferometry (LCI) endoscopic probe that can examine the cervix for evidence of cervical dysplasia. The device will make optical measurements of the cervix to determine:
1. the difference between two different types of cervical cells: ectocervical cells and endocervical cells. Cervical dysplasia is most likely to occur at the junction between these two types of cells.
2. features of individual cervical cells that indicate whether the cell is normal or abnormal (cervical dysplasia).

primary_outcome.measure: sensitivity of scanning a/LCI probe to detect cervical dysplasia
primary_outcome.description: determine the sensitivity of the scanning a/LCI probe's ability to detect cervical dysplasia when compared to the gold standard, histopathology

primary_outcome.measure: specificity of scanning a/LCI probe to detect cervical dysplasia
primary_outcome.description: determine the specificity of the scanning a/LCI probe's ability to detect cervical dysplasia when compared to the gold standard, histopathology

secondary_outcome.measure: identification of T-zone by scanning a/LCI probe
secondary_outcome.description: ability of scanning a/LCI probe to correctly identify transformation zone (T-zone) compared to colpophotography

intervention.description: Imaging of the cervical epithelium using the scanning a/LCI device.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- able to provide informed consent
- willing to abstain from sexual intercourse for at least 24 hours before study visit
Exclusion Criteria:
- pregnant
- have a current gynecological infection or discharge
- have had any cervical surgery
- had medical or cosmetic surgery involving the reproductive organs or genitals within the past 6 months
- currently enrolled in any research studies involving the application of vaginal formulations
- employed or supervised by the study investigators
- have any other condition, that, in the opinion of the study clinician, would contraindicate participation in the study
